Package ohos.media.audio

Class AudioWaver

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.audio.AudioWaver

  • public class AudioWaver
extends Object
    Provides the audio visualization feature.
    Since:
    4
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#AUDIO

      • AudioWaver

        public AudioWaver​(int sessionId,
                  String packageName)
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
        A constructor used to create a AudioWaver instance.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Indicates the ID of an audio playback session.
        packageName - Indicates an application package name.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if initialization of this class fails.

    • Method Detail

      • release

        public void release​()
        Releases audio visualization resources.
        Since:
        4

      • setDataSize

        public boolean setDataSize​(int size)
        Sets the size of audio data that can be captured.

        Before calling this method, obtain the supported size range via getMinDataSize() and getMaxDataSize() and ensure the data size set by this method is within the range. Otherwise, the setting fails.

        Parameters:
        size - Indicates the audio data size to set.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setActivated

        public boolean setActivated​(boolean activated)
        Activates or deactivates audio visualization.
        Parameters:
        activated - Specifies whether audio visualization will be activated. Value true means to activate the feature, and false means the opposite.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getMinDataSize

        public static int getMinDataSize​()
        Obtains the minimum size allowed for audio data capturing.

        The size of captured audio data must be within the allowed size range. For the maximum size allowed, see getMaxDataSize().

        Returns:
        Returns the minimum size of the audio data to capture.
        Since:
        4

      • getMaxDataSize

        public static int getMaxDataSize​()
        Obtains the maximum size allowed for audio data capturing.

        The size of captured audio data must be within the allowed size range. For the maximum size allowed, see getMaxDataSize().

        Returns:
        Returns the maximum size of the audio data to capture.
        Since:
        4

      • getMinInterval

        public static int getMinInterval​()
        Obtains the minimum interval allowed for audio data capturing.

        The minimum interval is used when you call setWaveDataObserver(ohos.media.audio.AudioWaver.WaveDataObserver,int) and setFrequencyDataObserver(ohos.media.audio.AudioWaver.FrequencyDataObserver,int) to ensure that the sampling interval is longer than or equal to the minimum interval.

        Returns:
        Returns the minimum audio capturing interval.
        Since:
        4

      • setWaveDataObserver

        public boolean setWaveDataObserver​(AudioWaver.WaveDataObserver observer,
                                   int interval)
        Sets an observer to listen for the time-domain waveform data at frequencies around the specific frequency.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        interval - Indicates the audio data capturing interval. You should use getMinInterval() to obtain the minimum interval and ensure that interval is greater than or equal to the minimum interval.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setFrequencyDataObserver

        public boolean setFrequencyDataObserver​(AudioWaver.FrequencyDataObserver observer,
                                        int interval)
        Sets an observer to listen for the frequency-domain waveform data at frequencies around the specific frequency.
        Parameters:
        observer - Indicates the observer to set.
        interval - Indicates the audio data capturing interval. You should use getMinInterval() to obtain the minimum interval and ensure that interval is greater than or equal to the minimum interval.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
